section.title: Literal Expressions
section.para: The simplest expressions are literals. A literal evaluates to itself.

section.title: Boolean Literals
section.para: The boolean literals are true and false.
section.programlisting: true ; evaluates to true false ; evaluates to false

section.title: Integer Literals
section.para: Integer literals are sequences of decimal digits, optionally preceded by a minus sign for negative numbers.
section.programlisting: 42 ; evaluates to 42 0 ; evaluates to 0 -7 ; evaluates to -7

section.title: Hexadecimal Literals
section.para: Hexadecimal literals start with 0x or 0X followed by hexadecimal digits (0-9, a-f, A-F).
section.programlisting: 0xFF ; evaluates to 255 0x1A ; evaluates to 26 0x0 ; evaluates to 0

section.title: Floating-Point Literals
section.para: Floating-point literals contain a decimal point separating the integer and fractional parts.
section.programlisting: 3.14 ; evaluates to 3.14 2.0 ; evaluates to 2 0.5 ; evaluates to 0.5

section.title: String Literals
section.para: String literals are enclosed in double quotes. They may span multiple lines, with line breaks preserved in the resulting string.

section.title: Character Literals
section.para: Character literals represent a single character, enclosed in backticks.
section.programlisting: `a` ; evaluates to a `Z` ; evaluates to Z
